newsitem.title: USA: Pa. 600 MW Homer City coal unit shut, seen up Mon.
newsitem.headline: Pa. 600 MW Homer City coal unit shut, seen up Mon.

text.p: A 600 megawatt (MW) unit at the coal-fired generating station in Homer City, Pennsylvania, was shut Thursday, and expected to resume operation late Monday, the operator GPU Generation Inc said.
The Homer City unit 2 was shut early Thursday to repair its flame scanner, which is part of the combustion control system, a company spokeswoman said.
Engineers are taking advantage of the shutdown to perform maintenance tasks, she added.
Pennsylvania Electric Co (Penelec) and New York Electric & Gas Corp, each have 50 percent stake in Homer City 2.
Both Penelec and GPU Generation are subsidiaries of GPU Inc of Parsippany, N.J.
